div1.p: Hench is interested in the proper preservation of the Finca San Jose.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Rojas, March 24, 1953
div1.opener:
March 24, 1953
Miss Maria Teresa Rojas
Finca San Jose
Redencion, Marianao
Habana, Cuba
My dear Tina:
div1.p:
It was so kind of you to receive our friends, the Wards. We have all been
so busy since their return that we have only had a chance to chat with them.
They had a delightful visit and were very grateful for your thoughtfulness.
It was very kind of you to have Doctor Nogueira call at the same time and
show them Camp Lazear. As Doctor Ward said, it certainly visualized what
I had been telling him.

It was kind of you to give Doctor Nogueira the extra copy of the SCIENTIFIC
MONTHLY. I only want to make absolutely certain that you did have an extra
copy. It is my recollection that I gave you one and then last year gave
Lidia one, but if I am wrong and if you gave away the only copy which the
Finca San Jose now has, you MUST let me know because of all people, it is
more important for you to have a copy than anybody else in the world as
that is the one “official” identifying article published by a board member.
Please do let me know. If I don't hear from you it means that you do have a
copy.

I have been working very hard on some papers and am far behind with my “yellow
fever” correspondence. I appreciate greatly your sending me the cortisone
interview and the clippings. I hope to finish the paper I am working on in
two or three weeks. I have been working on it night and day almost every night,
until three or four a.m. Thereafter I will send you at once a collection of
the photographs taken at the dedication of Camp Lazear (my own collection)
so that you may see them and let me know which ones you want copies of.

I had an inconsequential note from Mr. Bath not long ago. He and I still
have the Finca San Jose in mind and will certainly keep trying to think of
ways and means to help you in your fine cultural project. I think you know
me well enough to know that when I get interested in a project I practically
never give up and the proper preservation of the Finca San Jose is part and
parcel of the preservation of Camp Lazear.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
